alert.note: Alert for Graham; Haywood; Northern Jackson; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 8:41PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SHOWERS WILL PRODUCE VERY GUSTY WINDS ACROSS NORTHERN JACKSON, SWAIN, GRAHAM, AND HAYWOOD COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 838 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers producing very gusty winds from Graham to Haywood Counties in the southwest North Carolina mountains. The gusty winds are arising due to the combination of strengthening west to northwest winds behind a recently passed cold front and the arrival of the showers that are mixing stronger winds to the ground. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Shallow rooted trees may be toppled and isolated power outages are possible. Locations impacted include... Sylva, Waynesville, Bryson City, Robbinsville, Cherokee, Canton, Cullowhee, Lake Junaluska, Clyde and Maggie Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
